data.title: Add ByteArray class
data.body:
There are classes for all the other primitives, but not for byte. Please integrate?

This should be a simple search/replace call, but I cannot make pull-request with my strange git setup yet.. duh

Context: This will be used for creating a array backed ByteBuffer which is then pushed as a FloatBuffer into a Mesh. This in turn is needed for packed vertice values.

data.title: Fixed setting previousScrollFocus in Dialog class
data.body:
After dialog window has been shown, stage's scroll focus doesn't receive scroll events.
I have attached small fix for this.

Regarding case when some dialog's button creates (calls 'show') another dialog. 
Such behaviour leads to losing stage's scroll (and keyboard, actually) focus, because the new dialog is added before old dialog is removed. 

Also we need to restore scroll focus just when dialog begins to hide and not when animation is done.
Second commit fixes this issue.

data.title: Add FrameBuffer#bind/unbind
data.body: Related to PR #1094 and #1221, added two methods: FrameBuffer#bind() and FrameBuffer.unbind() (the latter being static), giving more control to the user.

data.title: Update to latest LWJGL [No Mac full screen support?]
data.body:
I read that lwjgl has included the native Mac OS X full screen.
https://github.com/LWJGL/lwjgl/issues/45

if I run in windowed mode and set my application configuration `resizable=true` then the icon still does not appear.

Is this not implemented yet or is this a bug?

I am running Mavericks and Java 7.
I tried using latest nightly build and latest stable release.

data.title: Modified the token replacement bug
data.body: Modified the bug that %APP_NAME% is not replaced in "android/res/values/strings.xml".

data.title: Improvements to header fixer tool.  Ran header fixer.
data.body:
Slight tweaks to header fixer tool:
- display count of files scanned/fixed (previously got no feedback when running tool and no files changed)
- do not write trimmed content after adding header, this will preserve EOF at newline.

data.title: update headless change info
Removed duplicate Net classes in headless
Add an HTML5 Bullet backend with Ammo.js?
data.body:
I am slightly annoyed that there is no Bullet backend for HTML5. It would be nice if one was written sometime. (I am definitely not qualified to write all that myself, it would end up with bugs in every method or something). One way it could be possibly implemented is with Ammo.js (https://github.com/kripken/ammo.js/) and GWT's JSNI. This would be very useful to me (and many other users, I'm sure).

Also, I'm sorry if there is already a post about this, I have no idea how to use GitHub...

data.title: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.LongMap should implement constructor with LongMap<V>
data.body:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.LongMap should implement a constructor with another LongMap<V>, analog to the other maps of java, for example HashMap:
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/HashMap.html#HashMap%28java.util.Map%29

Analog to issue https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/1235 this applies to all maps in com.badlogic.gdx.utils.

data.title: com.badlogic.gdx.utilsLongMap.Keys should implement Iterable<Long> and Iterator<Long>
Particle effects do not reflect what is shown in the particle editor.
data.body:
This issue has actually manifested itself in two separate occasions. I'll describe on of them. I created a projectile hit effect that had a life of 3000 ms.  When loaded into my game, it worked fine.  However, I made several changes, including dropping the life to 1500 ms (which is the most noticeable change), but the old effect still plays in the game.  I've double-checked that the .p file was saved correctly.  I can close the particle editor and then reload the .p file, and it is the new and correct animation.

I'm saving the particle effect files from the particle editor and then loading those into the game.

I also thought that perhaps the files were cached somewhere.  I cleaned the project in eclipse and also closed and opened eclipse with the -clean option.  I also deleted the libgdx files from User\AppData\Local\Temp.  Is there another place?  Is this a bug?  

As a reference, here is the current -Life- portion of the .p file
- Life - 
  lowMin: 0.0
  lowMax: 0.0
  highMin: 1000.0
  highMax: 1500.0
  relative: false
  scalingCount: 3
  scaling0: 1.0
  scaling1: 0.25490198
  scaling2: 0.3
  timelineCount: 3
  timeline0: 0.0
  timeline1: 0.6164383
  timeline2: 1.0

Please let me know if you need more information. Thanks!

data.title: Working iOS builds support
data.body: I've added support for working iOS builds, please see the commit note. Unfortunately, my repo is a hodge-podge where I've pulled from Tom-Ski's libgdx repo (named "upstream"), and the main libgdx repo (named "upmaster"), so my apologies in advance if this is too messy (if so, let me know and suggest a proper procedure and I will try to reapply my stuff on top of whatever repo has Tom-Ski's initial iOS support in it).

data.title: Extend GWT ReflectionCache with types used for Array.of
data.body: Fixing error introduced with https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/1217

data.title: Release audio in LwjglCanvas
data.body: And fix small typo.

data.title: BitmapFontCache.draw crashes if empty (problem is back)
VertexAttribute.Color() contains wrong numComponents (4 instead of 1)
data.body:
The method VertexAttribute.Color() does construct a VertexAttribute with Usage.ColorPacked, 4 elements and ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE.

This is not correct - the element count should be 1 instead of 4 (it is a packed color after all).

This issue was even hacked inside VertexAttributes.calculateOffsets(), as there is a branch for attribute.usage == VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, so the offset is not calculated wrong (using the numComponents of 4, would return a wrong offset of 16 instead of 4)

data.title: VertexAttributes should implement Iterable<VertexAttribute>
data.body: The VertexAttributes should implement an Iterator, so we can iterate trough the contained VertexAttribute array. Note, that the elements are expected to be in order.

data.title: [GWT]JSON parser error
data.body:
libgdx 0.99 gwt2.5.1

in GWT backend ,when to parser object throw a exception

code:

public class UserData {

```
private int search;

private int bomb;

private int reflash;
```

}

```

    Json json = new Json();
    String str = json.toJson(data, UserData.class);
```

data.title: typo in Sprite.java
added isDrawing()
data.body: Would be great if you could add this method :)

data.title: Adding flexibility to ParticleEffects
data.body: There is no need to force minimum time passed in these methods. The user can already set the time, when using ParticleEffect.draw(Batch spriteBatch, float delta). I would like this to be changed, because it ruins my way of recording game video frame by frame.

data.title: Updated AndroidManifest.xml to target API Level 19
data.body: gdx-backend-android is compiled with KitKat's android.jar now.

data.title: Removed unneeded wakelock permission from tests
data.body: The new wakelock we use doesn't require this permission

data.title: Added finer control over viewport setting on begin/end
data.body: As suggested in issue #1199

data.title: com.badlogic.gdx.math.Intersector.Intersector.isPointInPolygon suspicious
data.body:
Hi!

There seem to be two methods with this name, of which one seems to work as expected (Array<Vector2>) while the other one (float[], offset, ) either needs more comments describing the parameters to the method or it does not work as expected. 

I used the same polygon points for testing in both methods.  i moved them from the float[] to  the Array<Vector> and that worked fine. I used offset=0 and count=6 for the Hexagonal polygon i was working with in the non working test. Not sure what does two are for since count can be calculated from the array size (divide by 2). What is the offset for?

data.title: Make it impossible to scale BitmapFont to zero
data.body: For issue #1218

data.title: Calling BitmapFont.setScale(0) will make the font forever unusable
data.body: This happens because of implementation, that scales font relatively. When you scale to zero, any scales after it won't work. I am ready to write a pull request, however I am not sure how to handle this. Zero check that throws IllegalArgumentException? Assertion? Just write it in to the documentation?

data.title: Fix runtime type of Array.items to prevent ClassCastException
data.body: Related to issues GoogleCode#568 and GoogleCode#1423

data.title: Added Texture to GwtReflect.gwt.xml
data.body:
SpriteCache does not work in GWT as it uses Array.toArray in the endCache-method which tries to create a Texture array using reflection.

This is testable with the IsometricTileTest in GWT test runner.
